hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Africa: Nigeria: End Taylor's Refuge, Groups Urge

abstract.p: West African civil rights coalition, that includes representatives from Nigeria, Liberia and Sierra Leone, call on Nigeria to revoke former Liberian President Charles G Taylor's asylum and turn him over to Special Court for Sierra Leone to faces charges of crimes against humanity (S)

block.p: A coalition of West African civil rights groups called on Nigeria to revoke asylum for the former Liberian president, Charles G. Taylor, arguing that harboring an indicted war criminal violates the Nigerian Constitution. The coalition, which includes Nigerian, Liberian and Sierra Leonean organizations, called on Nigeria to turn over Mr. Taylor to the Special Court for Sierra Leone, a United Nations-backed tribunal that has charged the him with crimes against humanity. Nigeria offered Mr. Taylor asylum when he agreed to leave office in August.
